column5: anybody running these pedestals ..they hold up ? before I drop 170 a piece on em ...any feedback apprecitaed
I have one. Was using it since spring. Can't complain, does the job. But I have to admit its too expensive in my opinion.
I'm currently looking at getting some air ride pedestals for the front two seats in our boat.   Not many choices out there to be honest.
i bought one for where dad sits....  they are ok...but not great.
i got air rides when I bought my boat in 2001 and they lasted a year before they started falling apart. don't waste your money on them.
I'd rather have spring ride pedestals to be honest, but I can't find anyone that makes them.
that sucks ...is there a decent adjustable pedestal then

Bill  Try Smooth Move Seats  This is a hydraulic seat,  I tried to post link but would not work.  I found this while searching for the same thing as you.  I have a Toronto contact # if interested  Rick
research says good and bad ...Im gonna grab a couple see how things go...they worked cozy in the store and I like the height
Yes Brian  Those are the ones I was referring to
I've read up on the smooth move seat pedestals as well.  Decisions decisions!
I'd rather have spring ride pedestals to be honest, but I can't find anyone that makes them.  pm sent
I've seen guys put these on their boats and at a fraction of the cost.  http://www.princessauto.com/pal/en/Seats/Universal-Tractor-Seat-with-Suspension/8032915.p

I've seen guys put these on their boats and at a fraction of the cost.  http://www.princessauto.com/pal/en/Seats/Universal-Tractor-Seat-with-Suspension/8032915.p  Yup, this might be the ticket..  (Although I'd use the stock Lund back and cushion rest)
Bill,check out International truck on Mapleview. It cant hurt..  That smooth moves set up looks just like what they put in trucks.
Thanks man, and yeah it looks exactly the same...
